ticket.title: Rails routing breaks Java classpaths
ticket.original-body:
Rails routes are interfering with the loading of my Java applet's dependencies.
The problem seems to be that Rails is changing the dots in my classpaths to forward slashes.
Here's an example dependency from the logs that's failing:
ActionController::RoutingError (No route matches "/com/objex/panywhere/Pedigree_RS_Bundle.class" with {:method=>:get}):
Here's my embed code that works perfectly outside of Rails:
<object classid="clsid:CAFEEFAC-0016-0000-0000-ABCDEFFEDCBA" width="600" height="400"> <param name="archive" value="/artemis.jar" /> <param name="code" value="artemis.ProgenyAnywhereWrapper.class" /> <param name="codebase" value="."> <comment> <embed type="application/x-java-applet" archive="/artemis.jar" code="artemis.ProgenyAnywhereWrapper.class" width="600" height="400" codebase="."> <noembed>No Java Support.</noembed> </embed> </comment> </object>

<object classid="clsid:CAFEEFAC-0016-0000-0000-ABCDEFFEDCBA"

   width="600"
   height="400">

<param name="archive" value="/artemis.jar" /> <param name="code" value="artemis.ProgenyAnywhereWrapper.class" /> <param name="codebase" value="."> <comment> <embed type="application/x-java-applet"

  archive="/artemis.jar"
  code="artemis.ProgenyAnywhereWrapper.class"
  width="600"
  height="400"
  codebase=".">

<noembed>No Java Support.</noembed> </embed> </comment> </object>
version.title: Rails routing breaks Java classpaths

version.body:

I can send the code to whoever wants to see it.

version.title: Rails routing breaks Java classpaths

version.body:
It is not looks like framework error to me. =)
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/guide/plugin/developer_guide/using_tags.html
I think embed tag do not have archive attribute ;)
version.body-html:
It is not looks like framework error to me. =)

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/d...

I think embed tag do not have archive attribute ;)
version.title: Rails routing breaks Java classpaths

version.body:
The archive does indeed exist. It is used for loading .jar files as applets.
http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/struct/objects.html#adef-archive-OBJECT
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/components/applet.html#plugin
version.body-html:
The archive does indeed exist. It is used for loading .jar files as applets.

http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/...

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/t...
version.title: Rails routing breaks Java classpaths

version.body: Link that you've posted using <applet> tag, and you trying to use <embed> tag, which is different. This is not framework error. You should request jar file from server, and your HTML code is wrong - it asks .class file from server. Try to read the link , that I've provided, or ask on java applet forums.
version.body-html: Link that you've posted using tag, and you trying to use tag, which is different. This is not framework error. You should request jar file from server, and your HTML code is wrong - it asks .class file from server. Try to read the link , that I've provided, or ask on java applet forums.
version.title: Rails routing breaks Java classpaths

version.body: EMBED tag i different from APPLET tag
version.body-html: EMBED tag i different from APPLET tag
version.title: Rails routing breaks Java classpaths

version.body: Why has this been marked as invalid? Does that mean you don't want to fix it? Are you saying Rails won't ever work with Java applets? "As discussed" with who?
version.body-html: Why has this been marked as invalid? Does that mean you don't want to fix it? Are you saying Rails won't ever work with Java applets? "As discussed" with who?
version.title: Rails routing breaks Java classpaths

version.body: I assumed that Andriy's answer fixed your problem as you had not replied for an entire year. Has it not? If so, please provide a failing test case.
version.body-html: I assumed that Andriy's answer fixed your problem as you had not replied for an entire year. Has it not? If so, please provide a failing test case.

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
version.body-html:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
version.title: Rails routing breaks Java classpaths
